pubinfo.publish: Minnesota DNR - Ecological and Water Resources

citeinfo.title: DNR Hydrography - Lakes of Biological Significance

descript.abstract: This layer shows lakes meeting criteria for Lakes of Biological Significance (LBS). Lakes were identified and classified by DNR subject matter experts on objective criteria for four community types (aquatic plants, fish, amphibians, birds). Unique plant or animal presence was the primary measure of a lake's biological significance. Lakes were rated and grouped for each of the following communities: aquatic plants, fish, birds, and amphibians. Lakes were assigned one of three biological significance classes (outstanding, high, or moderate), which are defined in Section 5: Attributes (below). Many Minnesota lakes have not been sampled for plants and/or animals, so this list of lakes will be periodically revised as additional biological data become available. The goal of this list was to identify lakes that exhibit the highest quality features within any of the four assessed biological communities (as opposed to identification of lakes that exhibit diversity across communities). Therefore, a lake needed to meet criteria for only one of the community types (aquatic plants, fish, birds, amphibians) to be identified as a Lake of Biological Significance. Occurrences of high-quality features within the community types determined the biological significance rank. For a detailed description of criteria and analysis used, see: Lakes of Biological SIgnificance Criteria and Analysis 20150423 (pdf, 38k)
descript.purpose: To support planning, natural resource management, research and other resource protection-related activities

timeperd.current: Polygon re-delineations and edits are frequent and occur as needed. See the attributes DELINEATION_DATE and DELINEATION_SRC for date and source of each polygon. See CONTENT_DATE for last date of attribute updates.
Fish IBI scores are updated through 2011.

status.update: As needed (planned for every five years)

theme.themekey: Hydrography, Water, Lakes, Inland Waters, metrics, fish, aquatic plant, amphibian, bird, biological significance, priority, ranking, outstanding, high, moderate, LBS

cntperp.cntorg: Minnesota DNR - Ecological and Water Resources Division

horizpa.horizpar: Polygons have been improved by on-screen digitizing over DOQ and FSA imagery.

procstep.procdesc: The lake polygons are derived from the Open Water feature class of the MNDNR Hydrography Dataset. See Section 1: Associated Datasets.

attr.attrdef: Unique GIS record number of waterbody features in DNR Hydrography SDE - Open Water Features

A unique Fisheries Waterbody ID for joining/linking polygons to DNR Fisheries Lake Survey DB (Oracle). FW_IDs are assigned based on how the waterbody is managed by DNR Fisheries (i.e., an FW_ID may correspond to an entire basin '00' or to a specific sub-basin '01','02',etc.

edom.edomvd: A valid Fisheries Waterbody ID
A "dummy" Fisheries Waterbody ID representing an alternate representation of a basin (implemented in SDE Dataset only)
A "dummy" Fisheries Waterbody ID representing a non-MN portion of a border water

attr.attrdef: Waterbody ID per DNR Ecological and Water Resources (EWR) Division's LAKESDB database; the DOWLKNUM may end in"00" (entire basin) or "01","02", etc. (sub-basin)
Public Water (Lake) Name per DNR Ecological and Water Resources Division's LAKESDB database
Identifies whether basin is a sub-basin of a larger complex of basins

edom.edomvd: Yes, is a sub-basin; DOWLKNUM usually ends in '01', '02, '03, etc.
No, is not a sub-basin; DOWLKNUM usually ends in '01', '02, '03, etc.

attr.attrdef: Hydrologic feature type; based on original USCLASS attribute from USGS 100K DLG dataset; some polygons have been reclassified to better indicate their current hydrologic state
Lake Class per DNR Fisheries Investigational Report #417 - Schupp 1992 http://files.dnr.state.mn.us/publications/fisheries/investigational_reports/417.pdf
Surface area of waterbody in acres
Perimeter of shoreline in miles (includes island shoreline)
UTM Easting (X) of waterbody center
UTM Northing (Y) of waterbody center
County Name
DNR Administrative Region

edom.edomvd: Northwest Region (Bemidji)
Northeast Region (Grand Rapids)
Central Region (St. Paul)
Southern Region (New Ulm)

attr.attrdef: DNR Fisheries Administrative Areas (Fisheries Office)

attr.attrdef: Any notes related to the delineation.
Date the DNR Hydrography polygon layer was published or updated and re-published. PUBLISH_DATE efers to polygon delineations only. See CONTENT_DATE for date that attributes were last updated.

edom.edomvd: Indicates that the lake is a Lake of Biological Significance

attr.attrdef: Description of LBS class

edom.edomvd: Meets "Outstanding" criteria for at least one community
Meets "High" criteria for at least one community
Meets "Moderate" criteria for at least one community

edom.edomvd: Meets "Outstanding" criteria for the aquatic plant community
Meets "High" criteria for the aquatic plant community
Meets "Moderate" criteria for the aquatic plant community

Meets "High" criteria for the fish community

Meets "High" criteria for the amphibian community

attr.attrdef: Date the layer-specific attributes were last updated

overview.eadetcit: For a detailed description of criteria and analysis used, see: Lakes of Biological SIgnificance Criteria and Analysis 20150423 (pdf, 38k)
overview.eaover: The first set of attributes (DNR_HYDRO_ID through PUBLISH_DATE) are derived from and consistent with the Open Water feature class of the MNDNR Hydrography Dataset. See Section 1: Associated Datasets. The remaining attributes are specific to this layer. Lakes of Biological Significance (LBS) Criteria: Unique plant or animal presence was the primary measure of a lake's biological significance. Lakes were rated and grouped for each of the following communities: aquatic plants, fish, amphibians, and birds. There are three biological significance classes for this list: Outstanding, High, and Moderate.
